thread.title: 11-year-old boy, drenched in blood, calls 911 to report his dad stabbing his mom to death
thread.title_full: 11-year-old boy, drenched in blood, calls 911 to report his dad stabbing his mom to death

author: Tom Steele
title: 11-year-old boy, drenched in blood, calls 911 to report his dad stabbing his mom to death
text:
Close Close 11-year-old boy, drenched in blood, calls 911 to report his dad stabbing his mom to death Filed under Crime at Get Daily Dallas News Headlines Sign Up 
An 11-year-old Houston-area boy locked himself in a bathroom Wednesday morning and called 911 to say that his father had stabbed his mother. 
The father was later fatally shot by authorities. 
Capt. Bryan Carlisle of the Montgomery County Sheriff's Office said the boy called around 5:40 a.m. to report the violent act at his family's home in Conroe, about 40 miles north of Houston. 
"He was begging his father to stop stabbing his mother," Carlisle said. 
The boy stayed on the phone until sheriff's deputies arrived eight minutes later. He was drenched in blood when he came out of the house, Carlisle said. 
Two deputies went into the home and were confronted by the father â later identified as 41-year-old Medger Blake â who was holding a knife. When Blake refused to drop the knife and lunged toward them, they shot him dead. Deputies: Deceased suspect is Medger Blake, say he killed wife Rose Blake. They shot/killed him. Son, 11, called 911. #khou11 pic.twitter.com/af5kxlfxd5 — Lauren Talarico (@KHOULauren) February 22, 2017 
The boy's mother, 38-year-old Rose Blake, was found dead in a bedroom, Carlisle said. The boy was uninjured, and relatives were headed to Conroe to be with him. 
"Our hearts go out to the young boy," said Carlisle, who added that the boy is a hero. 
Lt. Scott Spencer of the sheriff's office said a note was found in the home, but he did not know who had written it. Authorities said there had been no previous reports of violence at the home. View Comments
